extractions.description: This paper proposes the Sparse Universal Transformer (SUT), which leverages Sparse Mixture of Experts (SMoE) and a new stick-breaking-based dynamic halting mechanism to enhance the Universal Transformer (UT) by reducing its computation complexity while retaining parameter efficiency and generalization ability.

type.justification: The paper conducts experiments on datasets like WMT'14 English-German translation, CFQ, and Logical Inference to validate the effectiveness of the proposed Sparse Universal Transformer (SUT).
type.quote: Experiments show that SUT achieves the same performance as strong baseline models while only using half computation and parameters on WMT’14 and strong generalization results on formal language tasks (Logical inference and CFQ).

name.justification: The primary applications and experiments in the paper focus on tasks related to Natural Language Processing including machine translation and logical inference.
name.quote: Experiments show that SUT achieves the same performance as strong baseline models while only using half computation and parameters on WMT’14 and strong generalization results on formal language tasks (Logical inference and CFQ).

name.justification: The experiments on the WMT'14 English-German translation dataset explicitly indicate that one of the sub-fields is Machine Translation.
name.quote: To demonstrate effective scaling, we perform experiments on WMT’14 English to German translation, showing that an SUT can achieve better performance for the same parameter count, while incurring less computation cost than an equivalent dense UT.

name.justification: The paper investigates the compositional generalization properties of the SUT using the CFQ dataset.
name.quote: Since the UT setting is a specific case of SUT, we show on the Compositional Freebase Questions (CFQ; Keysers et al. 2019) tasks that UTs have better compositional generalization properties, improving upon CFQ results from Csordás et al. (2021).

name.justification: One of the tasks used for evaluating the SUT is the Logical Inference task.
name.quote: Using the Logical Inference task (Bowman et al., 2015), we analyse the behaviour of our UT on length and compositional generalization.
